{
    "number": 192583,
    "data": "2,4,5,6,8,11,13,17,23,31,37,41,47,53,67,79,83,89,103,107,137,139,149,167,179,223,269,283,317,359,499,557,619,643,719,823,857,1097,1193,1433,1439,1699,1997,2153,2477,2879,3343,4457,6857,7159,8599,12919,41143",
    "name": "Monotonic ordering of set S generated by these rules:  if x and y are in S and xy+1 is a prime, then xy+1 is in S, and 2, 4, 6, and 8 are in S.",
    "comment": [
        "See the discussion at A192580."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "start = {2, 4, 6, 8}; primes = Table[Prime[n], {n, 1, 10000}];",
        "f[x_, y_] := If[MemberQ[primes, x*y + 1], x*y + 1]",
        "b[x_] :=",
        "  Block[{w = x},",
        "   Select[Union[",
        "     Flatten[AppendTo[w,",
        "       Table[f[w[[i]], w[[j]]], {i, 1, Length[w]}, {j, 1, i}]]]], # <",
        "      10000000 &]];",
        "t = FixedPoint[b, start]  (* A192583 *)",
        "PrimePi[t] (* A192530 Nonprimes 4,6,8 are represented by \"next prime down\". *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A192476."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,fini,full",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 04 2011",
    "references": 4,
    "revision": 4,
    "time": "2012-03-30T18:57:35-04:00",
    "created": "2011-07-05T13:00:58-04:00"
}
